programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.sub-title: No tears for the last match
programme.desc: One day, as Captain Hoshino's send off match nears, Kyoko asks Coach Munakata if she can be paired with Hiromi; then, she gives Hiromi a notebook filled with all of her shortcomings.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.desc: The South Kanto Training Camp, which takes the top junior players, is taking place with 17 players, including Hiromi; all of the strongest players that Hiromi's faced so far.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Ippo reads Mari's article; Ippo invites Nekota to his fight; both Sendo and Ippo have their weigh-in; Sendo and Ippo begin their rematch, with Ippo getting a very early knockdown on Sendo.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Sendo and Ippo's fight begins, guns blaze with the two giving each other blow for blow; Ippo finds out that Sendo has the advantage of having a bigger frame.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Ippo starts the third round by charging at Sendo but hesitates, which leads to Sendo beating Ippo all through the third round; the fourth round is more in the favor of Ippo.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: A flashback shows how Sendo joined his gym; Ippo gets knocked down twice, but when he gets up, the fifth round gets more brutal; the sixth round begins and is just as brutal as the last round.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: The match between Ippo and Sendo finally reaches its conclusion after seven ruthless rounds.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Ippo is a high school student that gets bullied on by the kids at his school; when a professional boxer introduces Ippo to the world of boxing, his life changes.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Ippo is granted his first sparring session.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Ippo shows enough potential to be accepted into the gym.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Ippo wakes up after a couple of days at the hospital; when Ippo is in the hospital he meets Mashiba's sister, Aoki, Kimura, Takemura, and Ippo go on a group date.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Date recaps of some of Ippo's fights.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo

programme.sub-title: Datto!!: The Blood Soaked School Sports Festival
programme.desc: The gang helps Keiichiro train for a sports festival at school; a mysterious boy shows up at the track, running alongside Keiichiro; despite the bonding between the two, it seems the new boy isn't quite alive.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: Night of Tragedy: The Demon Hand That Tears Through Doors
programme.desc: Stories spread about something preying on children who are alone, and the gang gets scared; especially since their parents will be out for the night; a deadly ghost with a sickle in hand stalks Satsuki and her friends.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: Utsushimi: The Soul Stolen by the Mirror!
programme.desc: People all over town begin acting strangely; most of them have been replaced by mirror-world clones of themselves; with Satsuki and Hajime being the last two people in the town who haven't been swapped, they'll have to find a way to end this ghost.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: The Ogre of the Underworld: The Circuits That Lead to Hell
programme.desc: Leo is convinced that there's a ghostly website out there on the internet and is determined to find it, which he does; trapped in the computer, the rest of the gang needs to figure out how to apply old-fashioned exorcism to new technologies.

programme.desc: Robotnik invents a ray that makes people turn into babies, and shoots Sonic, Tails and inadvertently himself; They are all taken to daycare, where they have to go the whole day without a time-out until the effects wear off.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Robotnik captures a kangaroo named MacHopper and uses his brain-wipe-reprogramming-computer to transform him into a resourceful demolitions expert.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: When S and G rocket to outer space to mine a radioactive mineral from asteroids, Sonic and Tails stow away.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Robotnik announces his intention to give up villainy, and Sonic is forced into retirement.

programme.desc: A half-man, half-duck named Brandon Quark appears with his robot servant in tow; he teams up with Robotnik to capture Sonic.

programme.desc: Dr. Robotnik acquires a magic wand and a book of spells from Wes Weasley; he tries to destroy the Mobius mint before it can release a Sonic banknote.

programme.desc: Dr. Robotnik tries to capture Breezy; Robotnik Jr. tries to turn Robotnik Falls into Robotnik Cliffs to cause a drought and build a robotic wife who can't be drenched by water.

programme.desc: Lupin sets his sight on the underground vault of a bank, but its extremely touchy alarm will make the heist difficult.
